CHAT.comment: Book Reading to mother; The Very Hungry Caterpillar

context notes say Mot and Chi sit at table. Chi reads haltingly but is very persistent. When Chi encounters a word she doesn't know , she sounds it out with good results. There is a lot of noise and other distractions in the background , but Chi is focused on the reading. Mot is impatient at times with her corrections of Chi. Mot's main strategy is to point to the word on the page and repeat it correctly for Chi

u.a: points to each word while reading title
points at the word with the paper in her hand
points to line with the paper in her hand
either with exhaustion from effort exerted so far or with apprehension in anticipation of what remains to be read
orders other children to put the dog down
corrects Chi using a bored tone
complaining to Mot about the dog barking
sound of pounding in the background
turns her attention back to Chi's reading
other people are talking in the background
there are no words on the page to read
MOT and Sis talk in background about the dog
possibly points to now at the beginning of the sentence
Chi questions her pronunciation of cocoon
